review_text: Beautiful little cove for swimming. My husband and I like to arrive by 9AM and lay in the sun on a towel on the beach for a little while and then rent chairs under the shade. It's a fun place to swim. Great people watching too as by 11AM-ish it starts to get pretty busy. Lots of families in the shallow water laughing and having a great time. Rental chairs are comfortable and a nice break from the sun. Excellent half day.

review_title: Okay not worth going out of your way for
review_text: Pretty beach but very crowded, more of a local beach since the waves aren’t as high as other beaches. The people working at the restaurants there are not very happy with the people that go there, kinda rude. I asked for price on two lounge chairs and umbrella, 400 pesos. I keeps walking to check out other prices and on the way I bought a coconut from another vendor. I went back to the original place to get the lounge chairs since that was the best price. The guys working there glared at us with darting eyes and said “no you can’t sit here any more because you bought something from another place.” Really you’re gonna turn down $400 pesos because I spent $70 on a coconuts? Ridiculous. Over all it’s okay, if it’s on your way check it out but otherwise you’re not missing much.

Such a beautiful beach to swim in the warm turquoise waters of Mexico! The beach was easy to find and we had a relaxing time day under a beach umbrella (paid 400MXN), however we were told this was a more chill spot with less tourists but this was definitely not the case. It was absolutely packed, would’ve loved to have hired a board to surf but there were a thousand kooks out and service wasn’t great - every one avoided us and couldn’t crack a smile out of anyone lol

The walk down the stairs was a bit difficult for my left knee that was banged up after a violent boat ride the previous day for dolphin watching.  Once you make the walk down the 167 steps, the beach is really beautiful and worth the effort to get to.  I watched the sunset one evening, then on my last day, I took a morning swim in the ocean.  Playa Carrizalillo is a fantastic gem of a place and a must visit!
Love this area!!!!!  best loction in Puerto Escondido! It's Beautiful, cool, laidback, quiet with a cool vibe, I highly reccomend it!

I visited half a dozen beaches in the area, and this was by far my favorite. I went in the morning when there was plenty of shade and enjoy chilaquiles prepared on the site for a reasonaly priced breakfast. The waves were gentle enough to swim in, but there were also surfers out.

review_title: Crystal clear water with great snorkeling
review_text: The best beach in Oaxaca Mexico in my opinion. The water is crystal clear and there are plenty of fish to see. It reminds me a lot of Hanauma Bay Hawaii.

review_title: Don't come here to surf unless you like huge crowds of beginners and angry locals
review_text: A nice beach, but always overcrowded. The surfing vibe is the worst I've ever seen - 50+ people out there all the time and people telling you to leave. Don't come here to surf because if you're not a local, and not Mexican, they will treat you poorly you and tell you to leave. Overall being white in Puerto Escondido means you mostly don't get treated well. Take your tourism or digital nomading elsewhere if you are white. Looks like it would be good for snorkeling.

My wife and I had the time of our lives on this beach. The clear water, the subtly dangerous waves, the weather, even the sexy people all around, made this a perfect spot to spend a day. Just choose your resting spot carefully because sudden waves may steal your sandals.

Beach restaurant rip off
Be careful as some of the restaurants here charge to rent the chairs with the food and drinks being extra to the chair rental. We had not experienced this elsewhere so make sure to ask what is included with the chair rental.

review_title: Great spot, to young for me..
review_text: Lovely spot, but it was like an 18/ 30 holiday vibe, so if you’re into that, great, I think I’m just too old for that now..unfortunately.

beautiful tropical escape.
go down many steps and watch the sunset.
the water was warm & it was a great beach to chill. it's off the beaten path & because of the steps less people go there.

We stayed and swam after a morning outing with Omar's Sport Fishing.  It seems to be mostly locals on this beach, although also saw some other tourists.  It is not so much a swimming location as a bob around relaxing in the water spot.  The beach is not huge and there are boats anchored nearby, but it was a really pleasant place to spend the afternoon.  I don't know that we would make a special trip (pay for taxi, etc.), but enjoyed the time since we were already there.

I rented a surfboard there and was not told by the surfboard rentals that there are violent surfers from the rental company.  I got punched surfing on the wrong side of the beach and I was far away from every surfer not posing a threat.   He wanted to drown me…The violent surfer said this is Mexico and I tell you where to go you go or I will kill you!   The guy may work for the surfboard company because I seen him with the surfboard rental area hanging out.

Excellent rooms,amazing sunsets , and being situated to a fab restaurant called Espadin, made it a good location.
Downside is the very small pool.

I tried to swim each day in different locale. This was my frist day visit and it was very crowded, and could really not find a good spot. Went to end and grabbed a chair at a club and ordered a beer just to cool down. Then took a long swim in calm water. This place sorry not for me

review_title: The most swimmable beach in Puerto Escondido.
review_text: Of all the beaches we visited this one was the only one that we got to really enjoy being in the water and got to swim a bit. It is mainly a surfing beach but there are a lot of people swimming too. The beds/chairs from the restaurants arepricey compared to other places so just sit on the sand.

Loved this beach. The water is crystal clear and relatively calm. You can float for hours if you wish.

Take a little cash. Best if you rent a few chairs with an umbrella and get drinks/snacks from the vendors.

We spent three days on the beach ... seemed consistently safe and friendly.

This is our fourth trip to PE. Sadly we can’t enjoy this stunning beach because of people bringing boom boxes. I just want to read a book, swim, and watch families and couples have fun. Don’t want someone else’s music blaring from two feet away. I get it. Not my country, not my beach. But now we go to club villasol at playa Bacocho which had sparkling showers, good food, same prices, clean pools, and uncrowded beaches where boom boxes are not allowed. It’s no more expensive and the tranquility is worth it.#donewithboomboxhell
There is 170 odd steps to get down to this beach and then back up however the beach is beautiful, surfers and swimmers flock to small beach
Clean and safe with good amenities and a family-friendly beach. The vendors have a good selection  of food and drinks available.

The beach itself, sheltered in a small inlet surrounded by cliffs, offers a wonderful place to relax and also a nice spot for surfing. The water is warm and crystal clear. Amenities are available. Beach lounges for rent. Inexpensive given it is a tourist destination.
Carrizalillo is closed to town... It is a great beach to swim, relax and have fun... and off course surfing classes!
This is one of the best beaches I’ve ever been to! Calm, warm waters for swimming, and soft sand. Wonderful location for watching the sunset!

Awesome, warm and smooth waves, I didn´t want to get out. Super recommended to relax. There weren´t many people and it was clean. The services near are ok but nothing special. If you are going because of the sea and enjoying the ocean, this is a place to go.
Apt of ppl surf here I think it’s good for beginners. I like to fish on the other side of the rocks there’s a tiny little beach type area.

The view from part way down the stairs to the beach and water below was stunningly beautiful. The water was so many different colours of blue. The beach was perfect for walking; not too long or too short. It was lovely watching the surfers riding the gentle waves. Nice cardio workout climbing to the top of the stairs after spending time at the beach.

Enjoyed the day at this beautiful location.  Be prepared for the big walk down to the water. Lots of surfers, but we were able to enjoy bobbing in the water. Not a snorkel beach.  Lots of vendors to buy food but be prepared to pay for your chairs for the day.

We were lucky enough to stay at a hotel on this gorgeous beach, so spent a lot of time there. The water was warm and beautiful and great for swimming or bobbing in the gentle waves. Renting loungers is a must to get some shade (the place with blue loungers was 250 for two, the next door place with orange loungers was 150 each), or claim a restaurant table and order food.

review_title: Great beach and great coconut shrimp
review_text: Loved the beach. We were told it would be crowded and not one day did we feel crowded....even on the weekend. Best coconut shrimp around!!  Don’t be afraid to try the seafood. It was fantastic. Can’t remember the name but we sat at the restaurant immediately to the left after coming down the stairs

review_title: Great spot, to young for me..
review_text: Lovely spot, but it was like an 18/ 30 holiday vibe, so if you’re into that, great, I think I’m just too old for that now..unfortunately.
